title: Improve DAG layout for large graphs in web UI
description:
## Objective

Implement a hierarchy-aware DAG visualization system with clustering and progressive disclosure that makes large dependency graphs (100+ issues) readable and navigable in the web UI.

## Problem

The current web UI DAG layout uses a simple hierarchical (dagre) layout that becomes unreadable with large graphs. Epic/story/task hierarchies are not visually distinct, making it difficult to understand strategic vs tactical relationships.

## Solution

A three-phase implementation:

### Phase 1: Subgraph Clustering Infrastructure ‚úÖ COMPLETE
- Cluster nodes by hierarchy level (epic containers hold stories/tasks)
- Hierarchical layout with nested positioning
- Virtual edge routing for cross-cluster dependencies
- Domain-agnostic cluster detection (no hardcoded type names)
- Comprehensive test coverage for clustering algorithms

**Status:** Implemented with TDD, all tests passing

### Phase 2: Collapse/Expand Interactivity ‚úÖ COMPLETE
- Interactive cluster headers toggle expanded/collapsed state
- Collapsed clusters show badge with hidden node count
- Virtual edges aggregate child dependencies at cluster boundaries
- Story-level collapse within expanded epic clusters
- Expansion state persistence via localStorage
- "Expand All" / "Collapse All" toolbar controls
- Hierarchy type icons (‚≠êüì¶üìù‚òëÔ∏è) with configurable presets
- Visual polish: colored headers, capitalized type names, proper alignment

**Status:** All core features delivered, 145 tests passing

### Phase 3: Advanced Features & Polish
- URL parameter persistence for shareable links
- Advanced animations and transitions
- Keyboard navigation shortcuts
- Search result focus with auto-expansion
- Minimap showing cluster overview
- Performance optimizations for very large graphs (1000+ nodes)

**Status:** Ready to begin

## Technical Architecture

- **Clustering:** Nested hierarchical algorithm (N and N+1 levels only)
- **Layout:** Extended Dagre with cluster-aware positioning
- **State:** React hooks with ExpansionState management
- **Edges:** Virtual edge aggregation for collapsed clusters
- **Configuration:** Hierarchy icons via config.toml with preset support

## Benefits Delivered

- ‚úÖ Large graphs (100+ issues) now navigable
- ‚úÖ Strategic vs tactical hierarchy visually clear
- ‚úÖ Progressive disclosure reduces cognitive load
- ‚úÖ Domain-agnostic design works with any hierarchy configuration
- ‚úÖ Excellent test coverage ensures reliability
